text: I think this joke was written with Phillipe as a retard, but he was later retconned to be 5 instead, so he lost the gross mouth feature.

text: Like a sweet-mannered car wreck. Still, he is good at talking with his mouth closed.

name: curdledboy
text: When I first came to Achewood and started working through the archives the previous strips got me warmed up, and this was the one that really smacked home with legitimate laugh out load moment. Stark physical comedy, beautifully done. Kudos, Onstad!

name: saturnbeads
text: Teodor always makes the greatest expressions!

name: joamiq
text: This is the first strip that I thought was hilarious (though "Bedtime" came close).

name: phy
text: I imagine it opening in a slow, laborious process, with heavy mechanical noises. Excited fanfare is blaring. Thunderbird 1 and 2 fly out.

name: wonelove
text: Teodor and Cornelius' faces.

name: snowman
text:
I wonder if this came out of Onstad trying to figure out how to draw Philippe with his mouth open.

This strip reminds me of what I love about Achewood: there are no rules. Onstad can make this joke and then later show Philippe opening his mouth in a different way, and it all just barely hangs together. It works.

name: coco
text: I like how Cornelius covers his mouth with both of his little hands. Shock abounds!

name: jjg
text: This ruins Philippe's innocence completely, now that he's half-shark-half-seal. GROSS

name: chachibenji
text: I imagine that when he opens his mouth it makes such a sound as "fwup". Like something that should not be.

name: farqussus
text: then a bustling woman puts her banking in him.

name: edwell
text: He says "Okay Teodor" and then opens his mouth.

name: voloshg
text: His right lip folds out.

text: this was i guess just an one-off non-canon joke. funny as all hell though

i have NO idea why

but when phillipe opens his mouth i picture him making the sound that the man with angry ticks that fire out of his nipples makes, in Don Hertzfeldt's "Rejected."

Is anyone else having trouble reconciling Cornelius' voice and the words "Okey doke?"
